document.docAuthor: Asenjo, Angélico, Irmler, Ulrich, Klimaszewski, Jan, Chandler, Donald S., Fierros-López, Hugo Eduardo & Vieira, Juliana S.
document.masterDocTitle: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Staphylinidae (Insecta: Coleoptera) in Latin America: synopsis, annotated catalog, diversity and distribution

subSubSection.paragraph: Only one species is known from and is restricted to Central and South America.

bibRefCitation.author: Fletcher, F. C.
bibRefCitation.refString: Fletcher, F. C. (1927) Undescribed Pselaphidae collected by Dr. J. C. Bradley in Panama (Coleoptera). Entomological News and Proceedings of the Entomological Section of the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia, 38, 149 - 153.

subSubSection.paragraph: Only one species is known from and is restricted to Central America.
Characters/Description: O. Park 1942: 284 (characters in key), 284 (characters); Comellini 1979: 689 (characters in key).

bibRefCitation.author: Comellini, A.
bibRefCitation.refString: Comellini, A. (1998) Notes sur les Pselaphides neotropicaux (Coleoptera, Staphylinidae, Pselaphinae). 10 - un nouveau genre et quatre nouvelles especes de la tribu des Metopiasini. Revue Suisse de Zoologie, 105 (2), 345 - 350.

subSubSection.paragraph: 5 species are known from and are restricted to Central and South America.
4 species are known from and are restricted to South America.
Characters/Description: Reitter 1885a: 334 (characters); Raffray 1908a: 187 (characters in key and characters); O. Park 1942: 204 (characters in key); Comellini 1993: 921 (characters).
10 species are known from and are restricted to Central and South America.
South America: Ecuador , Peru , Bolivia , Brazil .
4 species are known from and are restricted to South America.

Key:
Asenjo et al. 2017: 122
(species of the genus).

bibRefCitation.author: Raffray, A.
bibRefCitation.refString: Raffray, A. (1908 a) Coleoptera. Fam. Pselaphidae, pp. 1 - 487, 9 pls. In: Wytsman, P. (Ed.), Genera Insectorum. Fasc. 64. V. Verteneuil & L. Desmet, Bruxelles.

subSubSection.paragraph: 9 species are known from and are restricted to South America.
Characters/Description: Raffray 1908a: 187 (characters in key), 188 (characters); O. Park 1942: 205 (characters in key); Comellini 1994: 107 (characters).

bibRefCitation.author: Reitter, E.
bibRefCitation.refString: Reitter, E. (1885 a) Abbildungen und Bemerkungen zu wenig gekannten Pselaphiden-Gattungen mit Beschreibungen neuer Arten. Deutsche Entomologische Zeitschrift, 29 (2), 333 - 339, pl. 2 - 3.

subSubSection.paragraph: 20 are known from and are restricted to South America.
Characters/Description: Raffray 1908a: 187 (characters in key), 189 (characters); O. Park 1942: 204 (characters in key), 205 (characters); Comellini 1983: 438 (characters).
Key: O. Park 1942: 205 (species of the genus); Comellini 1983: 438 (species group).
South America: Colombia , French Guiana , Ecuador , Peru , Bolivia , Brazil , Paraguay , Uruguay , Argentina .
